content.rendered:
What is a Statistical Assistant?

Statistical Assistants organize and compile data for use in statistical studies.

Where does a Statistical Assistant work?

  • Research labs
  • Insurance carriers
  • Government

How much does a Statistical Assistant make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Statistical Assistant is $59,000.

What majors are typically in becoming Statistical Assistants?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Statistics majors
  • Math majors
  • Business majors
Explore roles on Handshake

Statistical Assistant skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Statistical Assistants succeed in their work:

  • Knowledge of relevant computer programs
  • Data entry skills
  • Great communication–written and verbal

What are some common questions about Statistical Assistants?

Q: What does a Statistical Assistant do?

A: Statistical Assistants’ tasks might include performing applicable computations, chart/graph creation, data analysis, or other tasks required by your specific company.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming a Statistical Assistant.
